Description: Side-blown trumpet with one half being a tube of straight wood with the mouth hole; the other half being part of an antelope's horn; with a loop of leather serving as a handle.
Curator's comments: The slip records that as from "East Central Africa". A later annotation suggests Uganda.
Acquisition name: Donated by: Isma'il Pasha, Viceroy of Egypt
Acquisition notes: Af,+.989 to 1003.a were presented to the BM by the Khedive of Egypt (Isma'il Pasha) on 1 December 1878, and had all been previously shown in the Paris Exhibition of 1878.
